info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 31 at 9:23PM EDT until July 31 at 11:15PM EDT by NWS Columbia SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of east central Georgia, including the following counties, Columbia, Lincoln and McDuffie.
* WHEN...Until 1115 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 923 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Thomson, Thomson-McDuffie County Airport, Wrightsboro, Mistletoe State Park, Appling, University Hospital McDuffie, Winfield, Amity Recreation Area, Ansley Mill, Clay Hill Campground, White Oak Campground, Thomson Fire Department, Carpenter Airport, Sweetwater Park, McDuffie Regional Medical Center, Phinizy, Eubank-Blanchard Community Center, Leah, Wildwood Park and Pollards Corner. - This includes Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 167 and 179. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don't drown.
Flooded roadways are nearly impossible to see at night. Avoid traveling in this area. Turn around, don't drown.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Columbia, GA; Lincoln, GA; McDuffie, GA
